paper_abstract: Despite the theoretical advances in probabilistic computing, A fundamental mismatch persists between the deterministic hardware that traditional computers use and the stochastic nature of probabilistic algorithms. The authors propose resonance energy transfer (RET) between chromophores as an enabling technology for probabilistic computing functional units. RET networks can implement efficient samplers with arbitrary probability distributions and have great potential for accelerating probabilistic algorithms.
paper_title: NANOSCALE RESONANCE ENERGY TRANSFER-BASED DEVICES FOR PROBABILISTIC COMPUTING
